result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic V. Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 days jail credit, if probation revoked

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  AODA and anger management assessment and any recommended follow up counseling/treatment per agent.  Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances except pursuant to a valid prescription.  No presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores.  Random UA's per agent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic V. Harvey

records.addlTxt:
1:34 PM Defendant Dominic V. Harvey in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Dominic V. Harvey.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Recess for parties to discuss offer.  State states the joint recommendations noting there is a VIS in this file - parties review that.  Atty Campbell and DE are in agreement.  Court questions DE on plea agreement.  DE pleads NC.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement on behalf of the joint rec.  Atty Campbell makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  DC as repeater - NC
Probation for 12 months
$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and anger management assessment and any recommended follow up counseling/treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances except pursuant to a valid prescription
No presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores
Random UA's per agent
Three (3) days credit if probation would be revoked
Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of any alcohol.  No bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business whose primary purpose is the sale/consumption of alcohol.

2:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dominic V. Harvey appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Court states case and appearances.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Address correct and DE does qualify for PD appt.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State makes bail recommendation.  Atty Markoski responds.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $100.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of any alcohol.  No bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business whose primary purpose is the sale/consumption of alcohol.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dominic V. Harvey not in court.  Signed bond with today's date.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
